messages.subject: Re: System improvements / ideas
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



Can I just manage expectations and underline some parts from: [REDACTED NAME] email.



So  as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a VALUE and we compare that against all the developments within the business.



You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these  eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.



Example - I have a live example of a request I have rejected  Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. I have done a quick calculation, and that development would assist us in less than .5% of all bookings. The actual dev would take 3-4 days. We dont have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200  we have to: [REDACTED NAME] manually somehow. The developments we MUST focus on are the ones to: [REDACTED NAME] team blockers, and thats what I will focus on.



This is YOUR team, managing YOUR pipeline in terms of priority. I am here to: [REDACTED NAME] process.



I dont want this appear to: [REDACTED NAME], you team need to: [REDACTED NAME] do anything and everything to help.but you guys must help yourselves in terms of organising the priority. So from: [REDACTED NAME] below  what are your TOP 3 in terms of delivering the highest value, and why ?



Can you chase up all the Team leaders for their recommendations and lets see and come up multiple times 



BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Wednesday, 22 May 2024 at 12:11
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: System improvements / ideas

Hi [REDACTED NAME],





Implementing several of these suggestions would undoubtedly benefit both the team and other departments.





ENS builder (how and when can we make it fully automated?).

ENS builder  Stena Line forms to: [REDACTED NAME] and validated. The team shouldnt be handling it.

PPB  Port passes to: [REDACTED NAME] and validated by operators' systems. (validation part is missing).

Information page reviewed, relevant information + booking process where applicable. Im already in discussion with John, he is pushing Zone leads for accurate information. To: [REDACTED NAME] the learning process we have requested a box to: [REDACTED NAME] How to book. Dev request was submitted last week.

F2 / F3 needs to: [REDACTED NAME] interactive, with some sort of reminders / warnings (pop-ups?)

F2  When booking an abnormal load, the price should disappear after selecting "abnormal."

F2  When repeating the job, weight, width, and height should automatically change to standard.

Zone leads to: [REDACTED NAME] accounts where possible + clear info in information tab (Virtu Ferries and smaller ones).

Additional EDIs where possible (Tallink  all bookings support).

Operators emails  Adding round-trip booking requests (Condor Ferries and IOM).

Amendments + Cancellation for EDI bookings to: [REDACTED NAME] (Web + App)









Regards,

E:[REDACTED EMAIL]

T:[REDACTED PHONE]

W:freightlink.co.uk

A:[REDACTED ADDRESS]





[REDACTED NAME]

Head of CS

messages.subject: Sales source etc
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, its a lot more complex than a simple sales source. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.



The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.



I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a house account. Hence the reason converted by X 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. 



Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc Fiona produced is also attached.



Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.



My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. Its not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest thats the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.



However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope thats all helpful.



Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] Stephens



[REDACTED NAME]

Director

[REDACTED NAME]

[REDACTED EMAIL]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



[REDACTED ADDRESS]

freightlink.co.uk





The content of this email is confidential and intended for the recipient specified in message only. It is strictly forbidden to: [REDACTED NAME] part of this message with any third party, without a written consent of the sender. If you received this message by mistake, please reply to: [REDACTED NAME] and follow with its deletion, so that we can ensure such a mistake does not occur in the future.

Good luck with the Sales Training tomorrow folks! Looking forward to: [REDACTED NAME] rewards of it allGo easy on John and [REDACTED NAME] they are new to: [REDACTED NAME]

messages.subject: Re: CSV export from F2
messages.body:
Just checking this dovetails with [REDACTED NAME] thinking ?



BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Wednesday, 15 November 2023 at 09:37
To: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: RE: CSV export from F2

Hi John



Apologies for the delayed response on this, we have not forgotten, and this has been discussed within the digital team.



I have now created 3 projects in the project log that havent been signed off but under investigation:



 1. 3T Integration- Excel download from F2 > Tom is looking at the excel export you require from F2 this week. Once we have more details we can get this scheduled in for development.

You have already noted that this will save you 20mins  3 hours a day depending on volume. Can you define those figures a little more:

 a. What volumes you at now? Including revenue
 b. Where do you expect the volumes to: [REDACTED NAME] in 1 month/2 month/3months and 6 months?



Additionally, is there any updates required in F2 for the finance team?



 2. Reload for contract Logistics > The question for this is do we add a new area in F2 for this or keep in reload. Under investigation.
     a. How much change is actually required compared with Reload?
     b. Can you scope something up for us, happily sit with you on this, need more of an insight in what you require.
     c. From: [REDACTED NAME] you note the time saving benefit for yourself and [REDACTED NAME], will this impact the customers in anyway?



 3. 3T Integration via API > This is on HOLD until figures have increased to a level that [REDACTED NAME] sign off. APIs do take time to: [REDACTED NAME] with the current pipeline for FL customer service this will be lower priority until we see those volumes pick up.



Please note I have little knowledge on the Reload part of F2 so this will be a good learning exercise for me.



Kind regards



E:[REDACTED EMAIL]

T:[REDACTED PHONE] & [REDACTED PHONE]

W:freightlink.co.uk & [REDACTED URL]

A:[REDACTED ADDRESS]





[REDACTED NAME]

Head of Operations

messages.subject: Reload 2026 & personal terms - Confidential
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means were not in a position to: [REDACTED NAME] packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and youll also benefit from: [REDACTED NAME] work from: [REDACTED NAME] following Johns departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to: [REDACTED NAME] hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, its vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to: [REDACTED NAME] you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, weve struggled to: [REDACTED NAME] this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To: [REDACTED NAME], we need to: [REDACTED NAME] a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. We cannot afford to: [REDACTED NAME] a plan that isnt delivering results. If something isnt working, we need to: [REDACTED NAME]quickly and decisively.
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Lets work together to: [REDACTED NAME] have a robust framework in place to: [REDACTED NAME] drive performance.
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary [REDACTED AMOUNT] plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target [REDACTED AMOUNT] per month (as discussed [REDACTED NAME] will agree these with you)
 * 01st Jan 2026 [REDACTED AMOUNT] (10.5% / [REDACTED AMOUNT])



For 2026, we will also amend your monthly targets as follows. This provides you with an easier initial target to hit (on budget), plus the ability to: [REDACTED NAME] more bonus as your overachieve.



[REDACTED NAME]

Month GP

Quarter GP

Annual GP

Annualised bonus if all achieved

[REDACTED NAME]

[REDACTED AMOUNT]

[REDACTED AMOUNT]

[REDACTED AMOUNT]

This is a substantial step forward and underlines our support of you. This must also be seen as a stepped change in not just your effort but your continued growth in professionalism. [REDACTED NAME], [REDACTED NAME] and myself are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] achieve the above, but also your personal growth goals.


Before we put this increase formally in writing from: [REDACTED NAME], I would like you to: [REDACTED NAME] have your full commitment going forward.


Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]


E: [REDACTED EMAIL]

MARK [REDACTED NAME]

Director

AOB

messages.subject: Commercial role
messages.body:
Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]s knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in [REDACTED COMPANY] is SALES. Matts engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed Jacob ratcheting the rhetoric with [REDACTED COMPANY] strategy. I must assume this is not just a Jacob thought. Equally we all agree [REDACTED COMPANY] holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight  [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill Jens role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]s direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over [REDACTED COMPANY] / [REDACTED COMPANY] sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with [REDACTED COMPANY] sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of [REDACTED COMPANY]..OR2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2  the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the [REDACTED COMPANY] POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]



[REDACTED NAME]

Director

[REDACTED NAME]

[REDACTED EMAIL]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



[REDACTED ADDRESS]

[REDACTED COMPANY].co.uk





The content of this email is confidential and intended for the recipient specified in message only. It is strictly forbidden to: [REDACTED NAME] part of this message with any third party, without a written consent of the sender. If you received this message by mistake, please reply to: [REDACTED NAME] and follow with its deletion, so that we can ensure such a mistake does not occur in the future.

Company registration number [REDACTED REF] | [REDACTED VAT]. All business is transacted under the current edition of the BIFA Standard Trading Conditions.

messages.body:
From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2024 3:57 PM
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Incoterm query



Good afternoon [REDACTED NAME],



I hope your keeping well, following on from: [REDACTED NAME] we discussed getting a dummy account for us to: [REDACTED NAME] and familiarise ourselves with so we can push the service when required to: [REDACTED NAME], and can talk it through to: [REDACTED NAME] encourage them to: [REDACTED NAME] new service, is it possible for this to: [REDACTED NAME] up?.



On a secondary note, we have had a query from a member regarding Incoterms, as per below:



As just discussed on the phone, we have quoted our customers based on FCA Germany, where the customer is collecting the material from: [REDACTED NAME] in Germany, who is responsible for the export clearance ?



The member is a UK based company, and their customer is also UK based, the material is manufactured in Germany, the member quoted the customer FCA Germany, and they are arranging collection.



It is our understanding that unless otherwise agreed upon, the seller is only responsible for loading the goods if the sellers place of business is the named place of delivery.



Can you shed any light or have a person within your team that would know this, I am happy to: [REDACTED NAME] member contact: [REDACTED NAME] we have dealt with this query for their future requirements.



Also, I am not sure a UK based company can actually perform export declarations on the German customs portal, or are they allowed.



Unfortunately, whenever customs or exporting comes in as a question we do refer members to a specialist customs agent and try not to: [REDACTED NAME].



Any help you can give will be greatly received.



Kind Regards, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]
Manager - Compliance Information

messages.body:

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Tuesday, 21 November 2023 at 22:22
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Commercial role

Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]s knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in [REDACTED COMPANY] is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]s engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with [REDACTED COMPANY] strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree [REDACTED COMPANY] holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight  [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill Jens role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]s direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over [REDACTED COMPANY] / [REDACTED COMPANY] sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with [REDACTED COMPANY] sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of [REDACTED COMPANY]..OR2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2  the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the [REDACTED COMPANY] POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] Stephens



[REDACTED NAME]

Director

messages.body:
FYI  See highlighted



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>

Subject: RE: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



John,



Thanks, [REDACTED NAME] attached, great starting point for our discussions!



Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] time and money to: [REDACTED NAME] results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and the Team, but it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!



Jay.



From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time



1  Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, [REDACTED COMPANY], [REDACTED COMPANY], [REDACTED COMPANY], why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to: [REDACTED NAME] inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levelsthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the companys core competency if messaging isnt clear and unified  IE [REDACTED COMPANY] is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isnt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to: [REDACTED NAME] and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, theres a risk of internal competition for the same business



2  If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to: [REDACTED NAME] this, I would need the bandwidth, autonomy and resource to do, I cant win business and not be able to deliver.
    * [REDACTED COMPANY] prime example  I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasnt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasnt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to: [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to: [REDACTED NAME] design tools similar to: [REDACTED NAME]  we dont do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isnt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. 
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to: [REDACTED NAME] and have the workload to: [REDACTED NAME] the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. 



3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to: [REDACTED NAME] transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects



This is unfortunately the reality of how logistics work, with very fine margins, high work levels and little reward, a lot of business is won on costs alone, and is a good fit for primary work already in place.



E:john@freightlink.co.uk

T:[REDACTED PHONE]

W:freightlink.co.uk

A:[REDACTED ADDRESS]



John Gaskell

Head Of Sales and Contract Logistics



Company registration number [REDACTED REF] | [REDACTED VAT].Email Disclaimer|Privacy|Terms & Conditions

All business is transacted under the current edition of the BIFA Standard Trading Conditions.

Hi [REDACTED NAME],



Working late. Bravo.



I think this is a good starting point. Well done !!!!



No it didnt come up.it really should have done. I will raise this with [REDACTED NAME].



Like the OLA angle  makes sense. Perfect !

The basic structure is sound. Well done  you are very good at these.



Each OLA needs to: [REDACTED NAME] specific.



Eg Item 1  Sales will do this, including this level of information, via this method of communication to Operations, and the desired output is that. Time frame to: [REDACTED NAME] X



Imagine you are writing a set of instructions for a new starter  it must be that level of detail.



I am not sure who has given you a steer on the items to: [REDACTED NAME] within the OLA. I think this need clearing up. I am guessing this will be [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME] to finalise.

I dont want to: [REDACTED NAME] be negative, but [REDACTED NAME] will not be dealing with any items like this until mid-April unfortunately. Perhaps when you discuss with [REDACTED NAME] ? messages.subject: Re: System improvements / ideas
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



Can I just manage expectations and underline some parts from: [REDACTED NAME] email.



So  as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a VALUE and we compare that against all the developments within the business.



You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these  eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.



Example - I have a live example of a request I have rejected  Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. I have done a quick calculation, and that development would assist us in less than .5% of all bookings. The actual dev would take 3-4 days. We dont have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200  we have to: [REDACTED NAME] manually somehow. The developments we MUST focus on are the ones to: [REDACTED NAME] team blockers, and thats what I will focus on.



This is YOUR team, managing YOUR pipeline in terms of priority. I am here to: [REDACTED NAME] process.



I dont want this appear to: [REDACTED NAME], you team need to: [REDACTED NAME] do anything and everything to help.but you guys must help yourselves in terms of organising the priority. So from: [REDACTED NAME] below  what are your TOP 3 in terms of delivering the highest value, and why ?



Can you chase up all the Team leaders for their recommendations and lets see and come up multiple times 



BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

Some very difficult but very important swift decisions need to: [REDACTED NAME], and he is more than aware of the situation. From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>

Subject: Incoterm query



Good afternoon [REDACTED NAME],



I hope your keeping well, following on from: [REDACTED NAME] we discussed getting a dummy account for us to: [REDACTED NAME] and familiarise ourselves with so we can push the service when required to: [REDACTED NAME], and can talk it through to: [REDACTED NAME] encourage them to: [REDACTED NAME] new service, is it possible for this to: [REDACTED NAME] up?.



On a secondary note, we have had a query from a member regarding Incoterms, as per below:



As just discussed on the phone, we have quoted our customers based on FCA Germany, where the customer is collecting the material from: [REDACTED NAME] in Germany, who is responsible for the export clearance ?



The member is a UK based company, and their customer is also UK based, the material is manufactured in Germany, the member quoted the customer FCA Germany, and they are arranging collection.



It is our understanding that unless otherwise agreed upon, the seller is only responsible for loading the goods if the sellers place of business is the named place of delivery.



Can you shed any light or have a person within your team that would know this, I am happy to: [REDACTED NAME] member contact: [REDACTED NAME] we have dealt with this query for their future requirements.



Also, I am not sure a UK based company can actually perform export declarations on the German customs portal, or are they allowed.



Unfortunately, whenever customs or exporting comes in as a question we do refer members to a specialist customs agent and try not to: [REDACTED NAME].



Any help you can give will be greatly received.



Kind Regards, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

messages.subject: FW: Lost Bookings last week
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



John asked me was there a way to: [REDACTED NAME] these lost bookings  short answer no, not without dev  with dev off top of my head is, a serios of new Cancelled  X reason



EG



Cancelled  operator no space

Cancelled  operator no response

Cancelled  booked another route

Etc etc etc



When speaking to John  in summary he is investigating standby bookings what he has discovered is there is a high number of bookings are cancelled because we were unable to: [REDACTED NAME] booking reference from: [REDACTED NAME] operator. If you look at the attached below there are 20 examples and when I did a quick analysis there are 13 cancelled bookings be because we were inefficient in obtaining a booking confirmation - that translates to 65%.



If we then use that statistic against all cancelled bookings it's a big number we are dealing with.



I know that CS are working very hard at standbys but there actually is a financial argument to having a dedicated resource on this. [REDACTED NAME] is providing more data to: [REDACTED NAME] he will analyse this further. I am fully aware that the CS team are manning up and training, but as an idea  could [REDACTED NAME] as an example to: [REDACTED NAME] but chase standby bookings to: [REDACTED NAME] improvements could be made ?



I know you are AL next week  just trying to: [REDACTED NAME] off.





BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

[REDACTED NAME],



I hope you are well and thanks, [REDACTED NAME] time earlier this week, hopefully we got some clarity on the expectations moving forward but let me once again confirm we are absolutely committed to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] moving forward.  1. Current Partnership Pipeline

[REDACTED NAME]  5 more or less ready to go, [REDACTED COMPANY] ([REDACTED NAME]) registrations are all complete etc IPARLA/RONCO for Spain/France and also the broker in Germany who can complete the personal effects and also complete in CZ.



[REDACTED NAME]  Also mentioned that the Polish broker is also setup and ready to go.



[REDACTED NAME]  14th March we have a board meeting with [REDACTED COMPANY] and we are required to provide a further update by the end of this current week.



Action  Provide [REDACTED NAME] full overview of the current partnership pipeline with an overview on each. Moving forward we need to deliver 9 new(inc current ones) partners and set up a formal onboarding process, so the [REDACTED COMPANY] and the wider business understand the processes, SLAs and any KPIs. We also need to: [REDACTED NAME] potential of reciprocal business envisaged.



 2. Current Lead List/Pipeline



[REDACTED NAME]  Explained current pipeline, explained warm, active, inactive and cold lists.



[REDACTED NAME]  Talk further about active, what have the volumes been so far from: [REDACTED NAME] active customers.



[REDACTED NAME]  So far only [REDACTED COMPANY] have traded with declarations and 1 transit, way short of the anticipated volumes.



[REDACTED NAME]  Explained none of the others have traded yet.



[REDACTED NAME]  Ill be honest here [REDACTED NAME] this pipeline isnt great, and we need to: [REDACTED NAME] even on the warm list if you take away [REDACTED NAME] there isnt much on there.



[REDACTED NAME]  Explained that it isnt fantastic, and it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] improvement with the amount in this pipeline.



[REDACTED NAME]  Lets have a look at the call reports which I receive for everybody, if you look at this you dont speak to: [REDACTED NAME] with many potential customers.



[REDACTED NAME]  Agreed I havent made as many calls as I should have, and I will make more calls going forward.



Action  A real focus on sales activity with a concentration on phone calls and face to: [REDACTED NAME]. Most of the activity is email based now and whilst this can be an effective form of new business development to gain a better understanding of requirement and build a better relationship direct contact: [REDACTED NAME].



Current targets  to deliver 650 declarations per month - [REDACTED AMOUNT] bonus paid annually.



In addition, for every 1000 extra declarations achieved over 7800 decs per annum [REDACTED NAME] to receive [REDACTED AMOUNT] additional bonus (based on [REDACTED AMOUNT] selling price declaration - for larger customers we will work on the profit per dec to: [REDACTED NAME] bonus per 1000 declarations).





 3. S&S GB Progress





[REDACTED NAME]  Any progress so far on S&SGB?



[REDACTED NAME]  Still early days as initial call was only last week but roughly around 300 hauliers have been identified.



Action  [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] current work agreed in the SSGB Review with a meeting to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2 weeks. If [REDACTED NAME] requires any support to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] deadlines are met.





 4. Training & Support Requirements



[REDACTED NAME]  If there is anything we can do to: [REDACTED NAME], please speak up we are here to help.

[REDACTED NAME]  No direct support currently needed apart from: [REDACTED NAME] reviews  [REDACTED NAME] offered internal assistance(see below).



Action  None required but [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] support or training requirements.





 5. End of Probation



[REDACTED NAME]  We are coming up to: [REDACTED NAME] of your probationary period and whilst the pipeline isnt great we will pass your probationary period but this pipeline has to: [REDACTED NAME] the coming months. We absolutely believe you are the right person to: [REDACTED NAME]. If there is anything else we can do to: [REDACTED NAME] please speak up.



[REDACTED NAME]  I would like more breathing space, if we look at Aldi talks nobody has got too exited about this one this is ideal and hopefully we can deliver. I have also been chasing up leads that other people have been working on, examples provided include John on [REDACTED COMPANY] and [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] the ATA carnets. Furthermore, completing the demos are taking too much of my time up, I can be waiting 20-30 minutes and then nobody turns up.

[REDACTED NAME] - Agree to: [REDACTED NAME] these areas and will discuss with [REDACTED NAME] and the [REDACTED COMPANY] to: [REDACTED NAME] communication.



[REDACTED NAME]  Mentioned you look at those inbound demo bookings and take your pick of what can/cant do and if your time is best, [REDACTED NAME] speak with [REDACTED NAME] and ask if [REDACTED NAME] can complete.



[REDACTED NAME]  Ok will do that would help.



[REDACTED NAME]  Any further comments from: [REDACTED NAME]?



[REDACTED NAME]  I completely echo what [REDACTED NAME] has said, I enjoy working with you but improvements must be made going forward to: [REDACTED NAME] increase in the pipeline.





 6. AOB



Nothing else to discuss.





As outlined, we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and I have attached the successful completion of your probation letter for use with your mortgage supplier. I am convinced that with extra focus you can achieve but as outlined we need to: [REDACTED NAME] improvement.



If we have missed anything or you have any feedback, please let me know.



Keep at it, the next big win is just around the corner!



Thanks, [REDACTED NAME].

messages.subject: FW: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics
messages.body:
FYI  See highlighted



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: 29 July 2025 14:22
To: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



John,



Thanks, [REDACTED NAME] attached, great starting point for our discussions!



Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] time and money to: [REDACTED NAME] results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and the Team, but it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!



Jay.



From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time



1  Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, GL, [REDACTED COMPANY], [REDACTED COMPANY], why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to: [REDACTED NAME] inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levelsthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the companys core competency if messaging isnt clear and unified  IE [REDACTED COMPANY] is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isnt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to: [REDACTED NAME] and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, theres a risk of internal competition for the same business



2  If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to: [REDACTED NAME] this, I would need the bandwidth, autonomy and resource to do, I cant win business and not be able to deliver.
    * [REDACTED COMPANY] prime example  I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasnt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasnt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to: [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to: [REDACTED NAME] design tools similar to: [REDACTED NAME]  we dont do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isnt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. 
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to: [REDACTED NAME] and have the workload to: [REDACTED NAME] the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. 



3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to: [REDACTED NAME] transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects



This is unfortunately the reality of how logistics work, with very fine margins, high work levels and little reward, a lot of business is won on costs alone, and is a good fit for primary work already in place.



E:john@freightlink.co.uk

T:[REDACTED PHONE]

W:freightlink.co.uk

A:[REDACTED ADDRESS]



John Gaskell

Head Of Sales and Contract Logistics



Company registration number [REDACTED REF] | [REDACTED VAT].Email Disclaimer|Privacy|Terms & Conditions

All business is transacted under the current edition of the [REDACTED COMPANY] Standard Trading Conditions.

Put simply, if you opted for a 4 hour retainer then we would discount by 15% to [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT and at my hourly rate of [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT under the retainer, this would equate to 4.5 hours.

Team,

I want to: [REDACTED NAME] importance of basic administrative tasks and policy requirements to: [REDACTED NAME] are consistently prepareddaily, weekly, and monthlywithout stress creeping in unexpectedly.

As you know, I strongly believe that preparation leads to performance. If were not prepared, were not performing. With that in mind, here are some key reminders to: [REDACTED NAME] on track.

Pack up at your finish time, not before.



Anyone wants to discuss, please dont hesitate to: [REDACTED NAME] me.

messages.body:
FYI



From: John. C Gaskell <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: 15 December 2025 11:50
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Re: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access



Good morning [REDACTED NAME],

Apologies for the delay in respondingI was awaiting further advice.

We will address each of the three matters separately rather than combining them into a single email.

Non-Compete Agreement

Regarding the non-compete agreement received, I am unable to: [REDACTED NAME] in its current form. The draft I briefly reviewed last Thursday included a defined time frame, whereas the version provided does not, and it also contains additional clauses that I did not propose or agree to.

As I am voluntarily entering into this agreement, I request the following amendments:

 * Removal of Sections 1, 2, and 3, as I did not agree to: [REDACTED NAME]. I remain aware of my existing contractual obligations, and this non-compete should serve only as an addition to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement.
 * Explicit statement that I am receiving no remuneration and that this agreement is voluntary.
 * A defined time limit, ending on 30 March 2026.
 * Clarification that I am signing to: [REDACTED NAME] and my daughter, [REDACTED NAME], ensuring normal working practices can continue and avoiding any conflict of interest.
 * Competitor companies must be specifically listed and limited to: [REDACTED NAME]. The current wording not limited to is too open to interpretation.
 * The agreement should become void upon Katies termination of employment, however that may occur during the stated period.
 * The scope must be restricted to: [REDACTED NAME] the Ferry, Rail, and Tunnel sectors of the business. Extending it to: [REDACTED NAME] operations leaves room for misinterpretation, particularly regarding freight forwarding or haulage companies.

I will forward a copy of the email I previously sent for reference.

DSAR

Once the above is resolved, I will advise on next steps. However, I reserve the right to exercise a DSAR in the future and will not sign any document that limits this right.

[REDACTED NAME]

At present, legal action remains only a potential consideration. A DSAR may be required to: [REDACTED NAME] further. I will not sign any document that prevents me from: [REDACTED NAME] action in the future, and I reserve all rights in this regard.

I hope we can resolve these matters promptly.

Im aware we are losing time as my employment terminates in 15 Days.

Kind regards, [REDACTED NAME] Outlook for Mac

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Friday, 12 December 2025 at 11:46
To: John. C Gaskell <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: RE: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access

Good morning John,



Thank you for your time yesterday, it was great to: [REDACTED NAME] too.

I can confirm that our meeting was held on a "without prejudice" basis. During the discussion, we shared documents confirming the business intention to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] 2026, subject to: [REDACTED NAME] set out in the Development Plan provided to: [REDACTED NAME] 25 September 2025.

Please find attached a copy of the Non-Compete Agreement, which will provide [REDACTED COMPANY] with confirmation that is no conflict of interest. I will send it via Signable immediately.

To: [REDACTED NAME] DSAR request, we will need written confirmation that you are withdrawing the request. You also confirmed you would provide written assurance that no further action will be taken against the business.

Kind regards, [REDACTED NAME]

messages.subject: FW: Sales source etc
messages.body:
BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Tuesday, 18 February 2025 at 22:41
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Sales source etc

Hi [REDACTED NAME],



As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, its a lot more complex than a simple sales source. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.



The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.



I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a house account. Hence the reason converted by X 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. 



Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc Fiona produced is also attached.



Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.



My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. Its not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest thats the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.



However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope thats all helpful.



Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

Dear [REDACTED NAME] and John,



Thank you both for your visit to [REDACTED NAME]. It was a pleasure to: [REDACTED NAME] here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.



I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:



Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * Denisa, needs to: [REDACTED NAME] API Specification ([REDACTED NAME]) to [REDACTED COMPANY]. Please find attached.
 * [REDACTED COMPANY] should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.
 * [REDACTED COMPANY] and UTA need to: [REDACTED NAME] use cases, with each party contributing their requirements.

Some points to: [REDACTED NAME] for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)



Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through [REDACTED COMPANY].
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to: [REDACTED NAME]?
 * John and I still need to: [REDACTED NAME] pricing and conditions.
 * [REDACTED NAME] will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a How To document for sales.



Sales Training:

 * Training sessions will be organized by region after we finalize the customs link and declarations in [REDACTED COMPANY].



In the [REDACTED COMPANY] Portal:

 * Replace box 3 with the [REDACTED COMPANY] offer.
 * Offer on Dover-Calais at [REDACTED AMOUNT] via [REDACTED COMPANY].
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for [REDACTED AMOUNT] via [REDACTED COMPANY], remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.



Offers - John:

 * [REDACTED COMPANY]
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services



Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] unaccompanied service to: [REDACTED NAME].



UTA Tolls:

 * Support [REDACTED COMPANY] with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.



Monthly Reporting:

 * [REDACTED COMPANY] will generate monthly reports to: [REDACTED NAME] with UTA.



Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through [REDACTED COMPANY]
 * Mandatory declarations





Additionally, in case youve changed your address due to: [REDACTED NAME] office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to: [REDACTED NAME]. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from [REDACTED COMPANY], that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to: [REDACTED NAME] for [REDACTED COMPANY]?



A follow-up meeting at the end of September to: [REDACTED NAME].



I look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] you.





Best regards,

[REDACTED NAME]





[REDACTED NAME]

messages.subject: Commercial role
messages.body:
Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]s knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in [REDACTED COMPANY] is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]s engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with [REDACTED COMPANY] strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree [REDACTED COMPANY] holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight  [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill [REDACTED NAME] role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]s direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over [REDACTED COMPANY] / [REDACTED COMPANY] sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with [REDACTED COMPANY] sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of [REDACTED COMPANY]..OR2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2  the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the [REDACTED COMPANY] POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.

[REDACTED NAME]

Re: Garden Leave and Ongoing Contractual Obligations

I am writing to: [REDACTED NAME] our conversation on Monday 20th October 2025.Under your notice period, your final date of employment with our organisation would have been 30th December 2025. However, instead of you working out your notice period, we have decided to: [REDACTED NAME] ongarden leavefrom 20th October 2025 in accordance with clause 21 of your Employment Contract.



This means that you will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] pay and benefits (with the exception of benefits that are given to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] job, such as a work mobile phone or car allowance) in the normal way. You remain bound by all the obligations and restrictions set out in your Employment Contract, save the duty to: [REDACTED NAME]. You will not be allowed to: [REDACTED NAME] work and must stay away from: [REDACTED NAME] during thegarden leaveperiod. During thegarden leaveperiod, you are not permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] other employment and are required to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] by our organisation and to: [REDACTED NAME] work requested by our organisation.



I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] that you are still bound by the obligations and restrictions set out in clauses below of your Employment Contract. For the avoidance of doubt, I set out below the clauses that apply:



 * Part 1, Clause 16: Confidential Information: You are strictly prohibited from disclosing, using, or retaining any confidential information acquired during the course of your employment. This obligation survives termination and is enforceable under both contractual and common law principles.
 * Part 1, Clause 21: Garden Leave:During any period of Garden Leave, you will remain an employee of the Company and bound by the terms of your contract.You must remain available to: [REDACTED NAME] any reasonable requests from: [REDACTED NAME], including attending meetings or providing information. All accrued unused holiday entitlement will be taken during Garden Leave. You must not contact: [REDACTED NAME] with the named parties in vii, or take alternative employment during Garden Leave without explicit consent from us.
 * Part 1, Clause 10 and Part 3: Post Termination Restrictions: Upon termination of your employment, you will be subject to: [REDACTED NAME] covenants set out in your contract, including but not limited to:
   * Non-compete obligations prohibiting engagement in any business that competes with [REDACTED COMPANY].
   * Non-solicitation and non-dealing clauses relating to clients, customers, suppliers, and employees of the Company.

 This matter was initiated solely by an email from [REDACTED NAME], asking me to sign a post-termination clause to: [REDACTED NAME].

 Upon my non-acceptance of this request, the company proceeded with what I consider emotional blackmail by targeting my daughter, restricting her employment opportunities, career development, and even threatening her future employment, by a non-existent conflict of interest .

 It was this action that prompted me, voluntarily, to: [REDACTED NAME] assurance limited to: [REDACTED NAME].



That said, I confirm that the amended agreement you have now provided is broadly acceptable, subject to: [REDACTED NAME] changes for your review.

I trust this clarifies my position and look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] matter constructively.



Kind regards, 

John Gaskell

Many thanks, [REDACTED NAME] your time today during the brief business standup. Whilst we are still finalising the final figures, we are quietly confident we hit budget again last month. If confirmed this will be a fantastic result for the businesswell done everyone ! SALES There is work to: [REDACTED NAME] in some of our ferry markets that were slightly short of budgets, but we are within touching distance. That final effort from: [REDACTED NAME] customer service to: [REDACTED NAME] bookings will make difference...so well done and keep up the hard work. CUSTOMER SERVICE After the success of CustomsLink offshore team, we have planned to: [REDACTED NAME] team further with 3 new team members to: [REDACTED NAME] amazing work that the Customer Service team deliver. This new team will focus on ENS and portpasses in preparation for ICS and ELO. We are now live with the new Sales / Customer service / CustomsLink dial function. This will improve the user experience for our clients, so they can contact sales, customer service and CustomsLink directly from: [REDACTED NAME] board. RELOAD After a successful Q1 and Q2, there is work to: [REDACTED NAME] with Reload, which [REDACTED NAME] and the team are looking to deliver. The results will come guys, keep going. CONTRACT LOGISTICS John and Contract Logistics are working hard to: [REDACTED NAME] ways of working with the dedicated vehicles. The existing forwarding volumes remain strong, with preparations for Q4 underway. MARKETING Marketing efforts continue to: [REDACTED NAME] results to: [REDACTED NAME] sales enquiries and bookings for both CustomsLink and Freightlink. The guys are hard at work looking at new ways to: [REDACTED NAME] clients better understand the complexities of ENS and portpasses and Customs. Standby for more news. Keep going guysgreat work. DVELOPMENT The development team are laser focused on delivering ICS2 upgrades, and whilst ELO has been delayed, we want to: [REDACTED NAME] for the 1st Sept, even if this is a manual process unto French authorities confirm our API. Whilst this will provide added complexities for our clients, this gives us additional commercial opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] clients. The dev team are also delivering some further upgrades to the Appv2, and the customs customer user experience, SMS service and a new mapping product. In the next 2 weeks, [REDACTED NAME] will be providing a monthly update with software release dates. CUSTOMSLINK CustomsLink has had another great month above budget, and the busiest month for [REDACTED COMPANY], so well done to: [REDACTED NAME] team. As reported, our ISO9XXXX was successful, so a big well done to: [REDACTED NAME] were involved. In other good news, [REDACTED NAME] coming back will give the team a real shot in the arm to: [REDACTED NAME] the platform and support the wider operations team....welcome back Dan. OPERATIONS The operations teams are now back to: [REDACTED NAME] now [REDACTED NAME] is back, lets all remember how large our data base is approx. XXXXXXX which is a herculean task to: [REDACTED NAME] top of this number of schedules and pricing for over 9000 clients! Thats more than many ferry companies. This relies upon all the teams helping them keep the data current, so please consider our agreed OLAs. Thank you for your patience at times. ACCOUNTS The accounts team are seeing the benefits of [REDACTED NAME] back in credit control and [REDACTED NAME] as xxxxxx who has supercharged the teams processing power. Great to: [REDACTED NAME] accounts team finally building a new team, ready for our future growth. HR [REDACTED NAME] is currently enjoying a well-earned break, and will no doubt return with a tan a smile and the normal high standard of HR support for the whole business. Meanwhile [REDACTED NAME] is doing a sterling job of developing her own skills supporting [REDACTED NAME] and the wider HR function, whilst also having a foot planted in the operations team. OFFICE MOVE [REDACTED NAME] is heavily involved with helping [REDACTED NAME] and I deliver the office move. We have another week or so effort to: [REDACTED NAME] office move. [REDACTED NAME] will provide an update in her weekly bulletin. [REDACTED NAME] and I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] all for all your immense hard work. The office move sees Freightlink and CustomsLink open a brand-new chapter of opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] a team. PS there could also be some little surprises coming your way from [REDACTED NAME] & the business. messages.body:
FYI  See highlighted



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>

Subject: RE: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



John,



Thanks, [REDACTED NAME] attached, great starting point for our discussions!



Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] time and money to: [REDACTED NAME] results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and the Team, but it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!



Jay.



From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics



Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time



1  Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, GL, [REDACTED COMPANY], Mardix, why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to: [REDACTED NAME] inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levelsthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the companys core competency if messaging isnt clear and unified  IE Reload is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isnt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to: [REDACTED NAME] and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, theres a risk of internal competition for the same business



2  If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to: [REDACTED NAME] this, I would need the bandwidth, autonomy and resource to do, I cant win business and not be able to deliver.
    * [REDACTED COMPANY] prime example  I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasnt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasnt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to: [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to: [REDACTED NAME] design tools similar to: [REDACTED NAME]  we dont do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isnt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. 
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to: [REDACTED NAME] and have the workload to: [REDACTED NAME] the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. 



3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to: [REDACTED NAME] transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects

Already had the conversation.



I have told John that [REDACTED NAME]s probation needs to: [REDACTED NAME], that may result in him making his own decision. He knows that discussion needs to: [REDACTED NAME] this week. We have had several really robust discussions, and I have told him to: [REDACTED NAME] on the vehicles but to: [REDACTED NAME] any work we currently have can be covered, we will do that before the end of next week.



We discussed that the budget is the budget, and we need a strategy/recovery plan and this will be down to: [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED COMPANY] solution. If it means we need another planner then so be it but as you point out [REDACTED NAME] is a very expensive asset and with the current performance in Reload we have lots of capacity internally.



He is pulling together a plan over the next few days and said we would sit down to have a high-level conversation before you return with a more in-depth decision making session on your return.



This for all the wrong reasons gives us the opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] amalgamating the 2 teams, neither in their current form have enough work so we need to act. [REDACTED NAME] is on annual leave at the moment, that wont have helped the figures as we know he manufacturers a quieter period when he, [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME] are on leave.



Some very difficult but very important swift decisions need to: [REDACTED NAME], and he is more than aware of the situation. Our first conversation this morning [REDACTED NAME] about his long term job security so he is in no doubt of the gravity of the situation. I did put his mind at rest but all other options for the wider team remain open!



Sorry for long reply!



[REDACTED NAME]

messages.subject: Re: System improvements / ideas
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



Can I just manage expectations and underline some parts from: [REDACTED NAME] email.



So  as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a VALUE and we compare that against all the developments within the business.



You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these  eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.



Example - I have a live example of a request I have rejected  Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. We dont have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200  we have to: [REDACTED NAME] manually somehow. Thank you for your email. For the purpose of clarity, I wish to: [REDACTED NAME] record the following:

 At no point have I requested, nor raised concerns, regarding my post-termination clauses with [REDACTED COMPANY].

 This matter was initiated solely by an email from [REDACTED NAME], asking me to sign a post-termination clause to: [REDACTED NAME].

 Upon my non-acceptance of this request, the company proceeded with what I consider emotional blackmail by targeting my daughter, restricting her employment opportunities, career development, and even threatening her future employment, by a non-existent conflict of interest .

 It was this action that prompted me, voluntarily, to: [REDACTED NAME] assurance limited to: [REDACTED NAME].



That said, I confirm that the amended agreement you have now provided is broadly acceptable, subject to: [REDACTED NAME] changes for your review.



 * This must state it replaces Part 3 vi, by mutual agreement, for the 6-month term.

 * [REDACTED COMPANY] signature must also be on the document, to: [REDACTED NAME] will sign first.



 * Whilst you cannot place Katies name: [REDACTED NAME] contract, I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] and place on record, I reserve the right to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement, should [REDACTED NAME] not be placed back onto normal duties immediately or her probation failed in a way I believe is another direct result of my choice to: [REDACTED NAME] business.



I trust this clarifies my position and look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] matter constructively.



Kind regards, 

John Gaskell





Sent from: [REDACTED NAME] Mac

To: John. C Gaskell <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: RE: Without prejudice -Subject to: [REDACTED NAME] John,



Many thanks, [REDACTED NAME] email. For the purpose of clarity, please can I confirm the companys position.



We sent you 3 emails on Friday, each intended to: [REDACTED NAME] various requests you have made over the last few weeks and try and move the position forward.



Post termination clauses



In response to: [REDACTED NAME] being comfortable with the existing post termination clauses, we provided you with two options:- 

 1. We offered to produce a new document which would supersede your existing post termination clauses. The executive summary of that document was contained within my email sent on 19thDecember. You confirmed that you are unwilling to: [REDACTED NAME] this as an option.
 2. On 17thDecember and again on 19thDecember, we sent over an agreement specifically listing the [REDACTED COMPANY] competitors, which we would consider as direct competitors to: [REDACTED NAME] Limited. This agreement effectively limits the scope of the Post Termination clause by excluding freight forwarders and hauliers, meaning the business would not take any further action should you chose to join a business providing these services. You confirmed that you are unwilling to: [REDACTED NAME] this as an option.

We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] matter. We have now made some further amendments to: [REDACTED NAME] document (number 2, attached) which we hope meets with your final satisfaction. Please could I ask you to: [REDACTED NAME] amended document. This document formalises what you have confirmed in email dated 21stDecember. If we received this signed document, this would also provide the business with assurances and remove any potential conflict of interest. Upon receiving this signed document, we would be delighted to: [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME] she is able to: [REDACTED NAME] the weekend / evening shift cover with our [REDACTED COMPANY].

However as detailed in my email on Friday,if we are unable to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement, we do still expect you to: [REDACTED NAME] the current restrictions. Any failure to: [REDACTED NAME] would amount to a breach of contract by you and your new employer and it would be open to: [REDACTED NAME] Limitedto: [REDACTED NAME] action against both of you.

 3. DSAR- We have received you email today. We will revert in due course.



Many thanks, [REDACTED NAME]
