Thank you for your email.



After reviewing the proposed terms, I need to: [REDACTED NAME] position clear. I cannot sign this document. The entire process was intended to: [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME] is treated as an individual employee and to: [REDACTED NAME], voluntarily, to: [REDACTED NAME] assurances that there is no current conflict of interest.

To: [REDACTED NAME], I have already provided an email listing the companies supplied by Freightlink that I will not be joining as an employee or competitor. This was offered in good faith to: [REDACTED NAME] and to: [REDACTED NAME] suggestion of conflict.

There is no deal to: [REDACTED NAME] here, nor any basis for an exchange of concessions. I am being asked to: [REDACTED NAME] additional and extended restrictions without any form of financial consideration or benefit. As it stands, the only beneficiaries of these proposed terms would be Freightlink, and I am not prepared to: [REDACTED NAME] an agreement on that basis.

I remain willing to: [REDACTED NAME] assurances regarding conflict of interest, but I cannot agree to: [REDACTED NAME] outlined in your proposal.



Kind Regards, [REDACTED NAME] Outlook for Mac

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Friday, 19 December 2025 at 17:01
To: John. C Gaskell <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Without prejudice -Subject to: [REDACTED NAME] John,



Thank you for speaking with Jay earlier today.



First of all, I wanted to: [REDACTED NAME] current contractual position to: [REDACTED NAME] uncertainty about your current restrictions. As you know, you have already signed an employment contract that includes a range of post-termination restrictions, including a 6 month non-compete clause. You have expressed concerns about referring to: [REDACTED NAME] the new agreement. However, you are still bound by the terms set out in your Employment Contract whether the new agreement expressly refers to: [REDACTED NAME] not. The only way the current restrictions can be varied is if we expressly agree to: [REDACTED NAME] the newagreement. Therefore, if we are unable to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement, we do still expect you to: [REDACTED NAME] the current restrictions. Any failure to: [REDACTED NAME] would amount to a breach of contract by you and your new employer and it would be open to: [REDACTED NAME] Limitedto: [REDACTED NAME] action against both of you. 



However, in light ofyour concerns and we are obviously very keen to: [REDACTED NAME] resolve things amicably, we would like to propose a new agreement (as discussed with Jay on the phone earlier) which will replace the current restriction in your previous Employment Contract .



These are the key points which will form the new agreement:



 1. Outline your willingness to: [REDACTED NAME] non-compete from: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], in exchange for 12-month non-solicitation and non-deal obligations



 2. Confirm that these restrictions will link to: [REDACTED NAME] date and are separate from: [REDACTED NAME] employment matters or other employees.



 3. Include obligations around data deletion, confidentiality, and disclosure of restrictions to: [REDACTED NAME] employer.



 4. We would include general obligations from: [REDACTED NAME] contract, such as the duty to disclose a copy of the new agreement restrictions to: [REDACTED NAME]/prospective employer and not to: [REDACTED NAME] out as being connected to: [REDACTED NAME] Ltd post-termination. We will also include an obligation for you to: [REDACTED NAME] in advance if you accept a job offer over the next 12 months.



 5. Address previous discussions regarding DSAR and grievance, and confirm that these could be withdrawn as part of the agreement. Whilst you are entitled to: [REDACTED NAME] of these, during recent meetings you have suggested that if we can get the restrictions in a new agreement finalised, you would not pursue these. If thats the case, we would include a clause in the agreement to: [REDACTED NAME] are withdrawing/not pursuing the DSAR and/or any grievance.



 6. Offer a standard reference as part of the agreement



If you would like to: [REDACTED NAME] offer, please let us know by 10.00am on Monday 22 December and a new written agreement will be circulated next week for your review which would need to: [REDACTED NAME] off before you finish your employment.



Kind regards, [REDACTED NAME]

messages.body:
FYI



From: John. C Gaskell <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: 15 December 2025 11:50
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Re: Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)  Personal Data Access



Good morning [REDACTED NAME],

Apologies for the delay in respondingI was awaiting further advice.

We will address each of the three matters separately rather than combining them into a single email.

Non-Compete Agreement

Regarding the non-compete agreement received, I am unable to: [REDACTED NAME] in its current form. The draft I briefly reviewed last Thursday included a defined time frame, whereas the version provided does not, and it also contains additional clauses that I did not propose or agree to.

As I am voluntarily entering into this agreement, I request the following amendments:

 * Removal of Sections 1, 2, and 3, as I did not agree to: [REDACTED NAME]. I remain aware of my existing contractual obligations, and this non-compete should serve only as an addition to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement.
 * Explicit statement that I am receiving no remuneration and that this agreement is voluntary.
 * A defined time limit, ending on 30 March 2026.
 * Clarification that I am signing to: [REDACTED NAME] and my daughter, [REDACTED NAME], ensuring normal working practices can continue and avoiding any conflict of interest.
 * Competitor companies must be specifically listed and limited to: [REDACTED NAME]. The current wording not limited to is too open to interpretation.
 * The agreement should become void upon Katies termination of employment, however that may occur during the stated period.
 * The scope must be restricted to: [REDACTED NAME] the Ferry, Rail, and Tunnel sectors of the business. Extending it to: [REDACTED NAME] operations leaves room for misinterpretation, particularly regarding freight forwarding or haulage companies.

I will forward a copy of the email I previously sent for reference.

DSAR

Once the above is resolved, I will advise on next steps. However, I reserve the right to exercise a DSAR in the future and will not sign any document that limits this right.

[REDACTED NAME]

At present, legal action remains only a potential consideration. A DSAR may be required to: [REDACTED NAME] further. I will not sign any document that prevents me from: [REDACTED NAME] action in the future, and I reserve all rights in this regard.

I hope we can resolve these matters promptly.

Im aware we are losing time as my employment terminates in 15 Days.

Kind regards, [REDACTED NAME] Outlook for Mac

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Friday, 12 December 2025 at 11:46
To: John. C Gaskell <[REDACTED EMAIL]>

Good morning John,



Thank you for your time yesterday, it was great to: [REDACTED NAME] too.

I can confirm that our meeting was held on a "without prejudice" basis. During the discussion, we shared documents confirming the business intention to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] 2026, subject to: [REDACTED NAME] set out in the Development Plan provided to: [REDACTED NAME] 25 September 2025.

Please find attached a copy of the Non-Compete Agreement, which will provide [REDACTED COMPANY] with confirmation that is no conflict of interest. I will send it via Signable immediately.

To: [REDACTED NAME] DSAR request, we will need written confirmation that you are withdrawing the request. You also confirmed you would provide written assurance that no further action will be taken against the business.

Kind regards, [REDACTED NAME]

messages.subject: Sales source etc
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, its a lot more complex than a simple sales source. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.



The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.



I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a house account. Hence the reason converted by X 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. 



Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc Fiona produced is also attached.



Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.



My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. Its not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest thats the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.



However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope thats all helpful.



Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]



[REDACTED NAME]

Director

[REDACTED NAME]

[REDACTED EMAIL]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



[REDACTED ADDRESS]

freightlink.co.uk

I don't want this to: [REDACTED NAME] complicated, but enough detail to: [REDACTED NAME] goal plus more, which we believe to: [REDACTED NAME] useful.

messages.subject: Commercial role
messages.body:
Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]s knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]s engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight  [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill [REDACTED NAME] role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]s direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2  the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the [REDACTED COMPANY] POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] Stephens



[REDACTED NAME]

Director

[REDACTED NAME]

[REDACTED EMAIL]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



[REDACTED ADDRESS]

[REDACTED COMPANY]

messages.subject: Re: SLA/OLA
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],



Working late. Bravo.



I think this is a good starting point. Well done !!!!



No it didnt come up.it really should have done. I will raise this with [REDACTED NAME].



Like the OLA angle  makes sense. Perfect !

The basic structure is sound. Well done  you are very good at these.



Each OLA needs to: [REDACTED NAME] specific.



Eg Item 1  Sales will do this, including this level of information, via this method of communication to Operations, and the desired output is that. Time frame to: [REDACTED NAME] X



Imagine you are writing a set of instructions for a new starter  it must be that level of detail.



I am not sure who has given you a steer on the items to: [REDACTED NAME] within the OLA. I think this need clearing up. I am guessing this will be [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME] to finalise.



Unlike a policy, I would make sure that the HOT are the signatories on this rather than directors. Make them responsible. If you want directors sign off, I recommend that the director responsible for the teams this impact signs off. EG In this instance, [REDACTED NAME] and I. We need visibility and understanding.



I dont want to: [REDACTED NAME] be negative, but [REDACTED NAME] will not be dealing with any items like this until mid-April unfortunately. Perhaps when you discuss with [REDACTED NAME] ? We are really under resourced over the next few months. I have already told [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME], other departments will have to: [REDACTED NAME] strain.



Ordinarily, I would be happy to: [REDACTED NAME] write this, but I must focus on my targets. I feel rubbish saying that..I hope thats ok! 100% keep running things past me, I am delighted to help.



I hope you have a good few days off [REDACTED NAME].



BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director



From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Monday, 17 February 2025 at 21:00
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: SLA/OLA

Hi [REDACTED NAME]

Did me/SLAs get discussed last week?

Im prepping a draft for meeting with [REDACTED NAME] next week. Ive never done a SLA before so google is my friend here, and Ive drafted the attached.

Im actually going to: [REDACTED NAME] Operational Level Agreements rather than Service Level Agreements  SLAs includes external parties, OLAs are for all internal parties apparently.

Please can you let me know your brief thoughts on the attached before I share with John and [REDACTED NAME]  is it too corporate?

Everything on there is just examples  I have no idea what has been agreed/drafted.

Thanks, [REDACTED NAME]





E:[REDACTED EMAIL]

T: [REDACTED PHONE]

W:freightlink.co.uk

A:[REDACTED ADDRESS]



[REDACTED NAME]

Head of HR

messages.body:
Just to: [REDACTED NAME] in the loop  I think [REDACTED NAME] will feel VERY VERY sore at this proposal.



Added to which I am sticking to: [REDACTED NAME] re Super Cargo which I think he feels undermines him, its a tricky moment in time.

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Tuesday, 21 November 2023 at 22:22
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Commercial role

Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]s knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. Matts engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed Jacob ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a Jacob thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight  [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill [REDACTED NAME] role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]s direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2  the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the [REDACTED COMPANY] POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]



[REDACTED NAME]

Director

messages.subject: Reload 2026 & personal terms - Confidential
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means were not in a position to: [REDACTED NAME] packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and youll also benefit from: [REDACTED NAME] work from: [REDACTED NAME] following Johns departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to: [REDACTED NAME] hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, its vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to: [REDACTED NAME] you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, weve struggled to: [REDACTED NAME] this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To: [REDACTED NAME], we need to: [REDACTED NAME] a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. We cannot afford to: [REDACTED NAME] a plan that isnt delivering results. If something isnt working, we need to: [REDACTED NAME]quickly and decisively.
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Lets work together to: [REDACTED NAME] have a robust framework in place to: [REDACTED NAME] drive performance.
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary [REDACTED AMOUNT] plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target [REDACTED AMOUNT] per month (as discussed [REDACTED NAME] will agree these with you)
 * 01st Jan 2026 [REDACTED AMOUNT] (10.5% / [REDACTED AMOUNT])



For 2026, we will also amend your monthly targets as follows. This provides you with an easier initial target to hit (on budget), plus the ability to: [REDACTED NAME] more bonus as your overachieve.

messages.subject: Proposed structure [REDACTED COMPANY] / [REDACTED COMPANY]
messages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],


Having had a few hours to: [REDACTED NAME] changes with Alex departing, this news presents immediate risks, but opportunities to deliver a considerable step up in our growth deliverables.


I have therefore quickly produced a proposal for structural changes which provides the best, [REDACTED NAME] success. Let's schedule in a call to discuss. Happy to have a conversation today and discuss in detail next Tue when back in work.


I hope this meets with your approval.


-----


Proposed Strategy 2025-2027
Key Focus: Profitability and Stability


Context:
With the departure of [REDACTED NAME] (AM) at the end of April, [REDACTED COMPANY] (FL) and [REDACTED COMPANY] (CL) must pivot strategy to: [REDACTED NAME] immediate impact and position the for long-term growth and stability. While the previous plan involved supporting AM in delivering major projects, [REDACTED NAME] (MS), will lead the transition, committing to: [REDACTED NAME] for the next five years to establish a robust structure that drives growth opportunities and ownership.


---


Business Overview:


[REDACTED NAME] 
- Relationship-driven and technology-focused business. 
- Relationships with ferry suppliers are critical to operations, supported by SaaS tools. 
- Freight ferry industry has limited key decision-makers meaning reputation is critical
- c.15 reputable freight ferry agencies across Europe.
- [REDACTED COMPANY] ranks third in size v competition with an UK / EU market freight ferry market share of <0.5%.


[REDACTED COMPANY] 
- Knowledge intensive business specializing in customs procedures presented via a SaaS platform. 
- Software domain knowledge is mission-critical for operations. 
- GB declaration market penetration of <0.01%.


Key Success Factors:
- Strong relationships with ferry operators. 
- Domain expertise in customs knowledge and software.


---


Challenges:


[REDACTED NAME] 
- AMs departure will destabilize operations for 3-6 months. 
- Staff, especially [REDACTED NAME] (low flight risk), will require reassurance and support during this period. 


[REDACTED NAME] 
- Ferry operators will react with scepticism and speculate about potential company sale or increased [REDACTED COMPANY] control. Competitors are likely to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME]s market reputation. 
- MS [REDACTED NAME] maintain direct, proactive engagement with ferry operators during the first 12 months to: [REDACTED NAME] concerns and reinforce trust.


---


Strategic Plan:


2025 (April - December):
- MS [REDACTED NAME] MD position; [REDACTED NAME] (JM) continues as Assistant MD. 
- MS [REDACTED NAME] JM split responsibilities, leveraging their strengths to: [REDACTED NAME]. 
- Initiate senior recruitment for [REDACTED COMPANY]. 
- MS [REDACTED NAME] on key staff development, particularly [REDACTED NAME], Jay, John, [REDACTED NAME], [REDACTED NAME], [REDACTED NAME], and the new Head of IT. 
- Controlled response in the market with MS [REDACTED NAME] relationships with ferry operators.


2026:
- Recruit an Operations Director in Q2-Q3, with [REDACTED NAME] as a potential candidate. 
- MS [REDACTED NAME] JM accelerate the development of the Operations Director, ensuring alignment with strategic goals.


2027:
- Transition Operations Director to: [REDACTED NAME]. 
- MS [REDACTED NAME] deliver project work 28+


---


Advantages:
1. Team Cohesion:
MS [REDACTED NAME] full support to: [REDACTED NAME] business and drive growth plans. Distractions are minimized to: [REDACTED NAME] and MS [REDACTED NAME] focus on strategic execution. 
2. Controlled Succession Plan: Smooth transition without knee-jerk recruitments. Succession planning aligns with growth milestones. 
3. Market Confidence:
Proactive engagement with ferry operators prevents reputational risks and reinforces relationships. 
4. Long-Term Commitment:
MS [REDACTED NAME] through to 2030 ensures sustained progress and stability.


---


Disadvantages:
- Delayed recruitment of a permanent MD.


---


Key 2025 Milestones:
- Office relocation. 
- Netherlands broker partnership established. 
- Mediterranean sales micro-office operational. 
- New Head of IT onboarded. 
- Phase 1 of F3 (back end operational system) automation/AI implemented.
- [REDACTED COMPANY] budget targets achieved. 
- Senior Management Team (SMT) development plan activated. 
- Realignment of MBO targets for JM and MS.


---


This refined proposal maintains a clear focus on stability, profitability, and structured succession planning while addressing key challenges and opportunities.


Suggested statement: External release as discussed; my suggestion would be to: [REDACTED NAME] comment regarding the MD position. Internal MS [REDACTED NAME] take on the MD role. Only ferry operators will be interested. MS [REDACTED NAME] be in contact: [REDACTED NAME] week.


BR
[REDACTED NAME]
Director

messages.body:
Just to: [REDACTED NAME] in the loop  I think [REDACTED NAME] will feel VERY VERY sore at this proposal.

Date: Tuesday, 21 November 2023 at 22:22
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Commercial role

Gents,



As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CVs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] rolewhilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].



If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as X learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. Its a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !



I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]s knowledge of CUSTOMS is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]s engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.



So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg.it is not a finished product !



See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-



 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight  [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here office manager so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill [REDACTED NAME] role with a relatively lower salaried project manager  30k -  35K  see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]s direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan  so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over [REDACTED COMPANY] / [REDACTED COMPANY] sales inc partners  I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of [REDACTED COMPANY]..OR2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I dont have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2  the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K  his old job was  90k)
 h. WILD CARD  is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through  but smells like 70K ????



I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I dont, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the [REDACTED COMPANY] POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. 



For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].



Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.



I really hope this helps in some way.



Best, [REDACTED NAME] Stephens

 Complete your ENS email sent to customer

  Booking details will be pre-populated on behalf of the customer from F2, they will need to: [REDACTED NAME]:

o Vehicle Details (Haulier EORI/address)

o Countries travelling through

o Consignment Information  they can add multiple consignments

If there is a genuine rejection  [REDACTED COMPANY] CS will notify FL CS > FL CS will update lassie with specific errors and customer will receive an email to: [REDACTED NAME] ENS then submit

Subject: New Performance Process & PIP

Hi [REDACTED NAME]



I hope you're well.



As part of our commitment to maintaining a consistent and supportive approach to: [REDACTED NAME] across the business, we are introducing a revised performance process that includes both informal and formal stages, along with a newPerformance Improvement Plan (PIP)template, both attached to: [REDACTED NAME].



As mentioned in my presentation back in June at the Away Day, its really important thatall stages of the process are followed carefully and documented in writing. This ensures we are fair and consistent in our approach, and that any performance concerns are addressed as early and effectively as possible.



Key Points:



 Informal Stage: This is the first step where concerns are raised and discussed constructively with the employee. Its an opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] and set clear expectations, and ideally, nip any issues in the bud. This stage is carried out by you, as the line manager, but Im always here to: [REDACTED NAME] support where needed.

 Formal Stage: If performance does not improve following the informal stage, the formal process should be initiated, using the PIP to: [REDACTED NAME] objectives, timelines and support measures.



If you If you have any questions or need support in implementing the process, please dont hesitate to: [REDACTED NAME].



Thank you for your attention to this.
